title: pubudu karunaratne
author: pubudu karunaratne
content: What are the other campagins that bounty manager Legit_Alt+ conduct before and paid to the bounty hunters    https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2704646

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Simply check the "last topics started by this person"[1], I found at least 3 campaigns he managed in its first page, you can find more (i guess) if you continue to the other pages.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;threads;u=2704646;sa=showPosts;

comments.author: fortunecrypto
comments.body: Quote from: pubudu karunaratne on July 19, 2022, 04:15:08 PMWhat are the other campagins that bounty manager Legit_Alt+ conduct before and paid to the bounty hunters    https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2704646Why asking for it, do you have issues on a campaign that he managed that you are included, is it a scam accusation or reputation issue, don't be lazy check the history of all his posts and you can see everything that he posted and that includes announcement of bounty campaigns that he managed.

comments.author: Strongkored
comments.body: Quote from: pubudu karunaratne on July 19, 2022, 04:15:08 PMThe last bounty he ran was proven to be paying can be seen in the spreadsheet but unfortunately the token value very low and the bounty participant receives very small prizes, that's the problem with the bounty if you don't pay it is very possible that participants will only receive tokens without value.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: pubudu karunaratne on July 19, 2022, 04:15:08 PMWhat are the other campagins that bounty manager Legit_Alt+ conduct before and paid to the bounty hunters    https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2704646The easiest way to do that is to check the bounty campaign section and check his username, I never read this username before as a bounty manager if you have a problem with this bounty manager, then post all your pieces of evidence on the scam section or private message him it's better that way than putting him in the spotlight or creating a thread for the bounty manager.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: Saisher on July 20, 2022, 12:00:02 PMThe easiest way to do that is to check the bounty campaign section and check his username... My guess is that the bounty board has hundreds of pages with threads. On the other hand, if you go to that user's profile page and check what threads he has created, you will see only 5 pages to work with. That's a much easier and quicker way to check what he has managed in the past than searching for his name among thousands of threads.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on July 19, 2022, 04:25:05 PMSimply check the "last topics started by this person"[1], I found at least 3 campaigns he managed in its first page, you can find more (i guess) if you continue to the other pages.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;threads;u=2704646;sa=showPosts;I advised this user the same thing. There were not many pages ( i think 1 page) so It was easy to count the number of campaigns ran by this person. I think they asked as they might be looking to hire a manager.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: or drop their profile in ninjastic.space which lets you filter user posts by board, see: https://ninjastic.space/user/id/2704646But whatever the outcome of their campaigns, you have to check that for yourself. I don't think anyone keeps track of it.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: pubudu karunaratne on July 19, 2022, 04:15:08 PMWhat are the other campagins that bounty manager Legit_Alt+ conduct before and paid to the bounty hunters    https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2704646I wonder if Legit_Alt+ is aware of this issue, based on how he asked us he seems to be doing an investigation on Legit_Alt+ the easiest to do that is to check his posts and check the scam section if he has a complaint, some bounty hunters will complaint if they did not receive their rewards, OP did not care to drop here and answer our question this is the first time I encounter a member asking about a particular bounty managers reputation.

comments.author: tbterryboy
comments.body: Quote from: coin-investor on August 01, 2022, 10:59:41 AMQuote from: pubudu karunaratne on July 19, 2022, 04:15:08 PMWhat are the other campagins that bounty manager Legit_Alt+ conduct before and paid to the bounty hunters    https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=2704646I wonder if Legit_Alt+ is aware of this issue, based on how he asked us he seems to be doing an investigation on Legit_Alt+ the easiest to do that is to check his posts and check the scam section if he has a complaint, some bounty hunters will complaint if they did not receive their rewards, OP did not care to drop here and answer our question this is the first time I encounter a member asking about a particular bounty managers reputation.If he ask the guy about it or the guy visits this section then he will definitely be aware of it but if none of that then not yet. I don't think it's some kind of an investigation but I think the op is only just a normal bounty hunter and wants to know the other bounties that the guy is managing but yeah why can't the op check the post history of that guy directly? That seem to be the fastest way to know or maybe he is literally a newbie and isn't aware of these things but now he know after reading our replies here.I don't think the op is questioning the reputation of this guy. Also this wasn't the first time that a user questions or complains about a manager but before they do it, make sure they read the rules of the campaign because sometimes it's not really the fault of the manager.
